intro: Elatostema jingxiense, commonly known as the Jingxi spiderwort, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests, and is often found in the Guangxi region. Its botanical features include a short stem, hairy leaves, and showy pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Elatostema jingxiense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
